result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shao C. Yang

records.addlTxt: (faxed to dispatch)

No contact with Salvation Army.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:07 PM Defendant Shao C. Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for Shao C. Yang.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Bergner informs the court of the reason for the defendant missing court and request the signature bond be reinstated
ADA Pfeil requests a cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Shao C. Yang
Current: 2111 Wisconsin Ave, Plover, WI 54467   (Effective: 05-27-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Plover, WI 54467

3:25 PM 
Defendant Shao C. Yang not in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Shao C. Yang.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Jambois calls case and states appearances.
ADA Jambois notes that the defendant does not appear today.
Court reviews the file and notes the defendant was informed of today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant authorized based on non-appearance of the defendant.
$1000 cash alternative.
Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriff's Dept.

1:07 PM Defendant Shao C. Yang appeared by video, in custody, Fond du Lac County Jail.  Attorney Anne Rec in court for Shao C. Yang, for Atty Bergner.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

State requests warrant to be quashed.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed. 

Atty Pfeil addresses the Court regarding bond.
Atty Renc addresses the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Signature bond is reinstated. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

Letter from the Defendant dated 08/09/22 with attached Order for Sanctions for Extended Supervision, Parole or Probation Violation and Notification to Client
Defendant is represented by Atty Bergner
Notice of Assignment of Judge- Return to sender insufficient address

1:47 PM Defendant Shao C. Yang not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
ADA Mutchler would request a warrant with a $500 cash alternative.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $500 cash alternative

Bond is reinstated 8/23/2022.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances knowingly.
No contact with Salvation Army
Participate in the Portage County Day Report Program on court dates only.  
Not to commit any new crimes.
Appear in court as directed
Not intimidate any victims/witnesses.
Written notice of change of address to Clerk of Courts within 48 hours.

Attorney Louis John Molepske Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shao Christopher Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule in court for Defendant Shao Christopher Yang. 
11:16 am  Court calls the case. 
Appearances are stated by Atty Molepske

Atty Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine; Possession of Drug Paraphernalia . 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Atty Soule indicates defendant is not eligible for public defender.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant to contact the Clerk of Courts with updated address. 
Atty Molepske states defendant can go to Post Office to set up general delivery

State requests a $2500.00 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for June 20, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 2
